run
Class process

java.lang.Object
  run.process

public class process
extends java.lang.Object

Core class for running fims processes. Here you specify the input file, configuration file, output folder, and a expedition code, which is used to specify identifier roots in the BCID (http://code.google.com/p/bcid/) system. The main class is configured to run this from the command-line while the class itself can be extended to run in different situations, while specifying fimsPrinter and fimsInputter classes for a variety of styles of output and input

Constructor Detail

process

public process(java.lang.String inputFilename,
               java.lang.String outputFolder,
               java.lang.String expedition_code,
               java.lang.Boolean write_spreadsheet,
               java.lang.Boolean triplify,
               java.lang.Boolean upload,
               java.lang.String username,
               java.lang.String password,
               java.lang.Integer project_id)
        throws FIMSException
Setup class variables for processing FIMS data.

Parameters:
inputFilename - The data to run.process, usually an Excel spreadsheet
outputFolder - Where to store output files
expedition_code - A distinct expedition code for the expedition being loaded, used to lookup expeditions in the BCID system for assigning identifier roots.
write_spreadsheet - Write back a spreadsheet to test to the entire cycle
Throws:
FIMSException

Run a query from the command-line. This is not meant to be a full-featured query service but a simple way of fetching results
